about:
I am a robotics engineer specializing in autonomy, perception, and field robotics, with hands-on experience developing real-world autonomous systems for agricultural and industrial applications. 
Most recently, I worked as a Robotics Engineer Intern at Bonsai Robotics, where I contributed to the development and improvement of the data collection pipeline for the company’s AMIGA robot series. My work focused on ensuring high-quality, structured field data to support perception and research teams. I also contributed to the development and testing of next-generation autonomy software running on NVIDIA Jetson–based systems, enabling robust autonomous operation in challenging agricultural environments. 
Previously, I served as a Robotics Engineer in Prof. Sunoj Shajahan’s Digital Precision Agriculture Lab at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. There, I designed and integrated key autonomy components including vision-based navigation, safety systems, and an autonomous vision-guided mechanical weeding system, all deployed and validated on the AMIGA platform for real-world field use. Earlier in my career, I worked as a Robotic R&D Intern at Rucha Yantra LLP, gaining hands-on experience with Autonomous Guided Vehicles (AGVs) and vision-based automation systems. My responsibilities spanned computer vision, navigation, and control, with deployments on hardware such as Raspberry Pi, NVIDIA Jetson, and diverse sensor suites. 
I hold a Master’s degree in Autonomy & Robotics from UIUC (Dec 2024) and a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management. I have been actively involved in robotics competitions and technical clubs, earning third place in the NASA Space Settlement Contest and first place in multiple drone competitions. 
I am currently seeking full-time opportunities in robotics and autonomous systems, where I can apply my experience in perception, autonomy, and field robotics to build intelligent, reliable robots that operate in complex real-world environments.
